Events that occurred on 11 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1955 - During a holiday to Italy, J.R.R. Tolkien and his daughter Priscilla make tourism around Assisi.
1966 - The Christian Science Monitor (11 August 1966), including an interview with J.R.R. Tolkien by Daphne Castell, is published.
1978 - Mythcon 9 in West Sacramento, California.
1984 - Mythcon 15 at Mills College in Oakland, California.
1986 - Mythcon 17 at California State University in Long Beach.
1997 - Mythcon 28 at Pepperdine University in Malibu, California.
2005 - The Tolkien Society's Tolkien 2005 conference in Birmingham, England.
2007 - Omentielva Tatya - 2nd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Antwerp, Belgium.
2011 - Omentielva Cantea - 4th International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Valencia, Spain.
2013 - Omentielva Lempea - 5th International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Helsinki, Finland.
2014 - Mythcon 45 in Wheaton College, Massachusetts.
2015 - Actor Richard Whiteside dies
2016 - Musician Glenn Yarbrough dies
2017 - Omentielva Otsea - the Seventh International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages at California State University, East Bay.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
